keyTakeAways: The last Ebola patient in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) has been discharged from a treatment centre in Bulape, Kasai province, marking a major milestone in the country’s response to the outbreak.
This is the 19th recovery out of 64 total cases (53 confirmed and 11 probable) since the outbreak began in September 2025.
Forty-five people have died during the outbreak, underscoring the high fatality rate of Ebola, which can be fatal in up to 90% of cases without treatment.
The remote location of Kasai province posed significant logistical challenges, prompting the WHO to deploy response teams and establish a real-world 32-bed treatment centre.
More than 35,000 people in the Bulape area have received vaccinations as part of preventive measures.
The outbreak, the 16th in the DRC’s history, began in September 2025 in the Bulape and Mweka areas and was declared on September 4.
No new cases have been reported since September 25, supporting the possibility of outbreak containment.

The World Health Organization (WHO) and partners played a pivotal role in the country’s response, with WHO director for Africa, Professor Mohamed Janabi, calling the recovery a 'remarkable achievement'.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The last Ebola patient in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) has been discharged from a treatment centre in Bulape, Kasai province, following a 19-case recovery out of 64 total cases since the outbreak began in September 2025. The outbreak, declared on September 4, originated in remote areas of the southwest and resulted in 45 deaths. With no new cases since September 25, the WHO has initiated a 42-day countdown to officially declare the outbreak over. The response, supported by WHO and local health systems, included the establishment of a 32-bed treatment centre and over 35,000 vaccinations in the affected region. The achievement is hailed as a 'remarkable success' by WHO director for Africa, Professor Mohamed Janabi, underscoring the effectiveness of coordinated public health efforts in a challenging and remote environment.
title: Last Ebola patient discharged in DR Congo, WHO says
